title: Merge pull request #19 from kashban/patch-2
message:
Merge pull request #19 from kashban/patch-2

Fix a crash with ProgressBar on Android 5.0

title: Fix a crash on Android 5.0
message:
Fix a crash on Android 5.0

ProgressBar on API 21+ uses an AnimatedVectorDrawable instead of an AnimatedDrawable, so that a ClassCastException occurs.

Changing this to the super class Drawable solves the issue.

title: Version 1.1.1
message:
Version 1.1.1

 • Working on issue #15
    • Officially deprecated the Progress Style as it is an anti-pattern. Find better more UX friendly ways to display loading information to your users.

title: Version 1.1.1
message:
Version 1.1.1

 • Working on issue #15
     • For some ungodly reason, Horizontal Indeterminate DOES NOT display, but setting a progress/max does. teh fuck. Probably going to switch to castorflex/SmoothProgressBar library for this one considering it is most rediculous
     • Possibly going to axe the entire ProgressStyle considering it is now an anti-pattern anyway.

title: Version 1.1.1
message:

 • Working on issue #15

 • Fix for issue #17

title: Merge pull request #12 from kashban/patch-1
message:
Merge pull request #12 from kashban/patch-1

Add OpenGL 2.0 requirement

title: Add OpenGL 2.0 requirement
message:
Add OpenGL 2.0 requirement

I just got an error report by a user with this exception:

java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
at android.view.GLES20Canvas.clipPath(GLES20Canvas.java:408)
at com.r0adkll.postoffice.widgets.RippleView.onDraw(SourceFile:220)
at android.view.View.draw(View.java:11281)
at android.view.View.getDisplayList(View.java:10720)
at android.view.ViewGroup.drawChild(ViewGroup.java:5783)
at android.view.ViewGroup.dispatchDraw(ViewGroup.java:5098)
at android.view.View.getDisplayList(View.java:10718)
at android.view.ViewGroup.drawChild(ViewGroup.java:5783)
at android.view.ViewGroup.dispatchDraw(ViewGroup.java:5098)
at android.view.View.draw(View.java:11284)
at android.view.View.getDisplayList(View.java:10720)
at android.view.ViewGroup.drawChild(ViewGroup.java:5783)
at android.view.ViewGroup.dispatchDraw(ViewGroup.java:5098)
at android.view.View.getDisplayList(View.java:10718)
at android.view.ViewGroup.drawChild(ViewGroup.java:5783)
at android.view.ViewGroup.dispatchDraw(ViewGroup.java:5098)
at android.view.View.getDisplayList(View.java:10718)
at android.view.ViewGroup.drawChild(ViewGroup.java:5783)
at android.view.ViewGroup.dispatchDraw(ViewGroup.java:5098)
at android.view.View.draw(View.java:11284)
at android.widget.FrameLayout.draw(FrameLayout.java:450)
at com.android.internal.policy.impl.PhoneWindow$DecorView.draw(PhoneWindow.java:2306)
at android.view.View.getDisplayList(View.java:10720)
at android.view.HardwareRenderer$GlRenderer.draw(HardwareRenderer.java:842)
at android.view.ViewRootImpl.draw(ViewRootImpl.java:2145)
at android.view.ViewRootImpl.performTraversals(ViewRootImpl.java:1869)
at android.view.ViewRootImpl.handleMessage(ViewRootImpl.java:2681)
at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:99)
at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:137)
at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:4517)
at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method)
at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:511)
at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:995)
at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:762)
at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method)

It's clearly coming from PostOffice using some OpenGL 2.0 API call. 

I find it best to put this requirement into the library from where it originates instead of in my App using the library. The Manifest merger should add it to my app manifest then.

What do you think?

Best regards,
Kash

title: Merge pull request #8 from kashban/patch-1
message:
Merge pull request #8 from kashban/patch-1

A definition file to support aboutLibraries-Lib

title: A definition file to support aboutLibraries-Lib
message:
A definition file to support aboutLibraries-Lib

This file allows AboutLibraries (https://github.com/mikepenz/AboutLibraries) to automagically detect used libraries and display the meta information give in this file.

Also this is an opportunity for PostOffice to become listed on the page of supported libraries: https://github.com/mikepenz/AboutLibraries/wiki/Compatible-Libs

Best regards,
  Kash
